meanings.definition: Dramatic or exaggerated behavior or actions intended to create a particular effect or impression.
meanings.sent1: Her theatrics during the argument made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The play was full of exciting theatrics that kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent3: His theatrics at the party were so over-the-top, it was hard not to laugh.
meanings.sent4: The politician's theatrics on stage were like a carefully choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The theatrics of the magician made the audience gasp in amazement.

meanings.definition: The art or practice of dramatic performance.
meanings.sent1: She studied theatrics in college to become an actress.
meanings.sent2: The school's drama club focused on teaching students the art of theatrics.
meanings.sent3: The children put on a play, showcasing their newfound theatrics skills.
meanings.sent4: The theatrics of the Shakespearean actors transported the audience to another time.
meanings.sent5: His passion for theatrics shone through every performance he gave.
